page.title: 16MISS PEET,FENSTANTON LADY
page.content: Miss Gertrude Peet, an eccentric old lady lived with her stepmother in the Manor House (CHEQUER STREET) during the war.She was the daughter of a baptist minister and a highly educated woman. { Miss Peet was a teacher at {Fenstanton school and also a graduate {at Cambridge University.She cycled to {Cambridge regularly on Fridays.Being {quite wealthy she owned a row of {cottages in Hall Green Lane.} Once she was brought before the magistrate for wearing trousers.She did all her own house repairs and had a tree trunk in her living room which she would feed to the fire.In 1941 when she died,her house was cleared out and her wedding dress and veil found in blue tissue paper.She had wrapped them up on the eve of her wedding when she was jilted.
